title: Australia at the World Athletics Championships
text:
<a href="Australia">Australia</a> has participated in every edition of the <a href="World%20Athletics%20Championships">World Athletics Championships</a> since the inaugural event in 1983. Australia is 15th on the <a href="World%20Athletics%20Championships">all time medal table</a>. 
Australia has won 12 gold medals, with 9 individual winners, and 36 medals total. <a href="Cathy%20Freeman">Cathy Freeman</a>, <a href="Jana%20Pittman">Jana Pittman</a> and <a href="Sally%20Pearson">Sally Pearson</a> are Australia's only multiple gold medal winners, with two each; Freeman (bronze) and Pearson (silver) have also each won a place medal. Other multiple medalists are: <a href="Dimitri%20Markov">Dimitri Markov</a> (1 gold, 1 silver), <a href="Jared%20Tallent">Jared Tallent</a> (3 silvers), <a href="Kerry%20Saxby-Junna">Kerry Saxby-Junna</a> (1 silver, 1 bronze) and <a href="Mitchell%20Watt">Mitchell Watt</a> (1 silver, 1 bronze). Australia's first <a href="World%20Championships">World Championships</a> medal was when by <a href="Robert%20De%20Castella">Robert De Castella</a> won gold in the <a href="1983%20World%20Championships%20in%20Athletics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20Marathon">Men's marathon</a> at the inaugural World Championships in 1983.
